channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: ‘We might be in a K-shaped recovery, but consumer spending is booming’: Healthy retail sales stave off recession fears
item.description: Two straight months of spending declines in April and May had concerned market watchers.

item.title: Luigi Mangione returns to court after 7 months, with a cult following watching him closely
item.description: Supporters of the 27-year-old Ivy League graduate often wear the Luigi video game character’s green color.

item.title: Federal Reserve to Meet Under Cloud of Trump’s Attacks
item.description: Stephen Miran and Lisa Cook will both cast votes at the central bank’s meeting on Wednesday, where policymakers are expected to lower interest rates.

item.title: Facebook, TikTok and even LinkedIn are censoring abortion content even when it’s just medical information, rights groups say
item.description: Electronic Frontier Foundation has collected close to 100 examples of content takedowns submitted by social media users that don't violate any policy.

item.title: How the Government Is Trying to Silence Charlie Kirk’s Critics
item.description: We look at the fight over free speech.

item.title: We Are Going to Have to Live Here With Each Other
item.description: Ben Shapiro and I discuss the state — and stakes — of political disagreement in America.

item.title: State Terrorism Charges Against Luigi Mangione Are Dismissed
item.description: The judge overseeing the case against Mr. Mangione said the evidence underpinning two of the most serious counts, one of which charged him with first-...

item.title: Tim Walz Seeks Third Term as Governor of Minnesota
item.description: Mr. Walz raised his national profile with a run for vice president. He has suggested that an additional term as governor would rule out the prospect o...

item.title: Robert Redford, the Sundance Kid turned Sundance mogul, entrepreneur and independent film champion, dies at 89
item.description: He bought two acres in Provo Canyon, Utah, after falling in love with the area on a 1961 motorcycle trip. It was the start of something big.

item.title: Former Biden official campaigns for California governorship with Spanish-language TikTok videos
item.description: “It’s critical to communicate in the language and on the platforms where voters spend their time and get their information,” Xavier Becerra said in a ...

item.title: European Countries Condemn Israel’s Ground Offensive in Gaza City
item.description: Some of Israel’s oldest allies criticized its latest military assault in Gaza and warned of a deepening humanitarian crisis.

item.title: Live Updates: Israeli Troops Push Into Gaza City, Forcing Desperate Palestinians to Flee
item.description: Hundreds of thousands of people remained in the city with hardly anywhere to go. Israel said the ground operation, after nearly two years of war, was ...

item.title: Where will people in Gaza City go?
item.description: There are few places for people in Gaza City to flee to, even as Israel launches its ground offensive.

item.title: Russia Indoctrinates Children From Occupied Ukraine at 210 Sites, Study Says
item.description: War crime investigators at Yale discovered a program of re-education and military and police training that was larger than estimated earlier.
